segment.source: Modifies XAML compilation behavior, such that fields for named object references are defined with public access rather than the private default behavior.
segment.target: Modifies XAML compilation behavior, such that fields for named object references are defined with public access rather than the private default behavior.

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Modifies XAML compilation behavior, such that fields for named object references are defined with public access rather than the private default behavior.
segment.target: Modifies XAML compilation behavior, such that fields for named object references are defined with public access rather than the private default behavior.

segment.source: x:Name attribute must also be provided on the same element.
segment.target: x:Name attribute must also be provided on the same element.

segment.source: The value for the x:FieldModifier attribute will vary by programming language.
segment.target: The value for the x:FieldModifier attribute will vary by programming language.

segment.source: The string to use will depend on how each language implements its CodeDomProvider and the type converters it returns to define the meanings for TypeAttributes.Public and TypeAttributes.NotPublic.
segment.target: The string to use will depend on how each language implements its CodeDomProvider and the type converters it returns to define the meanings for TypeAttributes.Public and TypeAttributes.NotPublic.

segment.source: For C#, Microsoft Visual Basic or Visual C++ component extensions (C++/CX), you can give the string value "public" or "Public"; the parser doesn't enforce case on this attribute value.
segment.target: For C#, Microsoft Visual Basic or Visual C++ component extensions (C++/CX), you can give the string value "public" or "Public"; the parser doesn't enforce case on this attribute value.

segment.source: You can also specify NonPublic (internal in C# or C++/CX, Friend in Visual Basic) but this is uncommon.
segment.target: You can also specify NonPublic (internal in C# or C++/CX, Friend in Visual Basic) but this is uncommon.

segment.source: Internal access doesn't have any application to the Windows Runtime XAML code generation model.
segment.target: Internal access doesn't have any application to the Windows Runtime XAML code generation model.

segment.source: x:FieldModifier is only relevant for elements with an x:Name attribute, because that name is used to reference the field once it is public.
segment.target: x:FieldModifier is only relevant for elements with an x:Name attribute, because that name is used to reference the field once it is public.

segment.source: Note Windows Runtime XAML doesn't support x:ClassModifier or x:Subclass.
segment.target: Note Windows Runtime XAML doesn't support x:ClassModifier or x:Subclass.
